sections.purpose: To ensure safe storage of flammable liquids and prevent fire hazards.
sections.scope: Applicable to chemical storage in the Pharmaceutical Chemistry department.
procedure: Verify that the cabinet is FM approved or UL listed for flammable storage.
Organize containers such that labels are clearly visible from the front.
Keep the total volume of liquids within the cabinet's rated capacity.
Ensure all container caps are tightly closed before placing them inside.
Place liquid containers in secondary containment trays to catch spills.
Maintain the grounding wire connection if the cabinet is grounded.
Inspect for leaks or damaged containers on a weekly basis.
Keep the cabinet doors closed and latched when not in use.
precautions: Do not store oxidizers or corrosive acids inside the flammable cabinet.
Avoid placing the cabinet near exit doors or heat sources.
Ensure the ventilation bungs are either sealed or vented to the outside.
Never store paper, cardboard, or other combustibles inside the cabinet.
Use non-sparking tools when working inside or near the cabinet.
